framework
Class ConstraintNetwork

java.lang.Object
  framework.ConstraintNetwork
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActivityNetwork, AllenIntervalNetwork, DistanceConstraintNetwork, FuzzyActivityNetwork, FuzzyAllenIntervalNetwork, FuzzySymbolicVariableNetwork, MetaVariableConstraintNetwork, NullConstraintNetwork, RectangleConstraintNetwork, RectangleConstraintNetwork2, SimpleTemporalNetwork, SpatialFluentNetwork, SpatialNetwork, SymbolicVariableNetwork
public abstract class ConstraintNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class implements the necessary functionality to maintain networks of Constraints. It is used by all ConstraintSolvers and provides methods to add and remove Variables, Constraints, querying the network for constraints, incident edges, etc. It also provide basic graphical rendering functions. Note that all implementing classes must call the one argument constructor.

Author:
Federico Pecora
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ConstraintNetwork

public ConstraintNetwork(ConstraintSolver sol)
Instantiates a new ConstraintNetwork. Note that all implementing classes must call this constructor (i.e., specifying a ConstraintSolver is mandatory).

Parameters:
sol - The ConstraintSolver which maintains this ConstraintNetwork.
Method Detail

addSubstitution

public void addSubstitution(VariablePrototype vp,
                            Variable v)
Convenience method to keep track of correspondences between VariablePrototypes and Variables (useful when ConstraintNetworks are used as meta-values in MetaConstraintSolvers).

Parameters:
vp - The VariablePrototype.
v - The Variable that corresponds to the given VariablePrototype.

getSubstitution

public Variable getSubstitution(VariablePrototype vp)
Get the Variable corresponding to a given VariablePrototype (see addSubstitution() method).

Parameters:
vp - The VariablePrototype to look up.
Returns:
The Variable corresponding to the given VariablePrototype.

getConstraint

public Constraint getConstraint(Variable from,
                                Variable to)
Returns the Constraint between two given Variables (if it exists). If more than one exists, it returns one of them (no guarantees as to which one).

Parameters:
from - The source variable of the Constraint to find.
to - The destination variable of the Constraint to find.
Returns:
The Constraint between the two given Variables, null if no such Constraint exists.

getConstraints

public Constraint[] getConstraints(Variable from,
                                   Variable to)
Returns all Constraints between two given Variables.

Parameters:
from - The source variable of the Constraints to find.
to - The destination variable of the Constraints to find.
Returns:
All Constraints between the two given Variables, null if no such Constraint exists.

checkDomainsInstantiated

public Variable checkDomainsInstantiated()
Checks whether the domains of the Variables in the ConstraintNetwork are instantiated. This is used by the ConstraintSolver class to assess whether automatic propagation whould occur (in some CSPs, domains of Variables cannot be instantiated by the Variable constructor, rather an explicit call to a dedicated method is necessary - see, e.g., SymbolicVariables).

Returns:
null if all domains are instantiated; a Variable whose domain is not instantiated if one exists.

draw

public static void draw(ConstraintNetwork cn,
                        java.lang.String title)
A static method for drawing ConstraintNetworks. This method is static so that it can be called to draw an object of a subclass (Java enforces late-binding). This method instantiated a JFrame containing a rendering of the ConstraintNetwork. The rendering is dynamic and attempts to animate transitions when Constraint and/or Variables are added/removed from the network.

Parameters:
cn - The ConstraintNetwork to draw.
title - The title of the JFrame containing the rendered ConstraintNetwork.

draw

public static void draw(ConstraintNetwork cn,
                        java.lang.String title,
                        Callback cb)
A static method for drawing ConstraintNetworks. This method is static so that it can be called to draw an object of a subclass (Java enforces late-binding). This method instantiated a JFrame containing a rendering of the ConstraintNetwork. The rendering is dynamic and attempts to animate transitions when Constraint and/or Variables are added/removed from the network.

Parameters:
cn - The ConstraintNetwork to draw.
title - The title of the JFrame containing the rendered ConstraintNetwork.
cb - A Callback object to use when the button is pressed.

draw

getEdgeLabel

public java.lang.String getEdgeLabel()
Get a String representation of this ConstraintNetwork (note that MetaConstraintSolvers use ConstraintNetworks as resolvers, therefore this method is used to draw the edge label in the search tree rendering).

Returns:
A String representation of this Constraint.
